page.title: 01Gazatteer:The whole area.
page.content: This area is very rural with fields being predominantly pasture.Grain crops are also important,the most common being barley and winter wheat.At Knightsbridge there are two large nurseries one specialises in flowers,the other in salad crops. Settlement in the area is very scattered,the 6 villags each contain between 15-50 properties.There are two old churches,one at Boddington the other at Elmstone Hardwicke that are clearly the oldest buildings in the area,although evidence of earlier settlement can be seen from the ridge and furrow marking near Elmstone.An important feature in this area is the M5 Motorway.There is a junction that allows access and exit to and from the north.In contrast to this the River Chelt and the canal are areas for wildlife.
